snippet: The 1991 Persian Gulf war has been cast as a model for a successful intervention, but debates continue today about the way the White House brought the war to an abrupt end.
abstract: Persian Gulf war in 1991 has been cast as model for successful intervention, but debates continue today about White House decision to bring war to abrupt end; some analysts say outcome of that war, which left Saddam Hussein in power and forced the United States to carry out more than a decade of air patrols over Iraq, led to US invasion of Iraq in 2003.
lead_paragraph: The 1991 Persian Gulf war has been cast as a model for a successful intervention, but debates continue today about the way the White House brought the war to an abrupt end.

headline.seo: Victory Over Iraq in 1991 Was Swift, but Flawed
headline.main: 1991 Victory Over Iraq Was Swift, but Hardly Flawless
headline.print_headline: A ‘Good War’ With Iraq in ’91 Had Its Flaws

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
